title: Figma Unveils Three AI-Powered Tools for Seamless In-Canvas Image Editing

paragraphs.content: Figma launched three new AI-powered image editing tools—Erase object, Isolate object, and Expand image—on December 10, 2025, allowing designers to make precise edits directly on the canvas without exporting to external software like Photoshop. These tools integrate with existing features such as Remove background and Crop into a unified toolbar for quicker access, prioritizing high-use actions like background removal. Available in Figma Design and Figma Draw for Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plans with AI enabled, they emphasize granular control without text prompts.

paragraphs.content: The Erase object tool uses an improved lasso for selecting and removing unwanted elements, while Isolate object separates subjects for effects like blur, lighting, or desaturation, preserving background traits. Expand image extends backgrounds to new aspect ratios, such as square to landscape, ideal for web banners or social media without distortion. These features reduce workflow friction for marketers and content teams by enabling on-the-fly adjustments during reviews.

sections.title: Breakdown of Erase, Isolate, and Expand Capabilities

paragraphs.content: Erase object streamlines cleanup by letting users lasso and remove elements from mockups or campaigns directly in Figma, eliminating platform switches. Isolate object allows selection of a subject for separation, movement, or adjustments like shadow, color, or focus, maintaining image realism. Expand image fills extended areas intelligently, supporting resolution boosts for low-res assets across formats.

paragraphs.content: The lasso tool's precision ensures stable colors, lighting, and textures post-edit, avoiding AI distortions common in other tools. A revamped contextual toolbar centralizes these with Crop and annotations for efficient access. Figma identifies background removal as a top action, now prominently placed to match user habits.

paragraphs.content: Design professor Nehmat Gereige called the tools "extremely efficient and useful" in a December 11 tutorial, demonstrating seamless object selection, erasure, isolation, and expansion without leaving Figma. Content teams benefit from faster test variations and brand-consistent UI mockups, reducing design team dependencies. Experts praise the shift to in-house edits for cross-functional reviews, cutting back-and-forth on minor tweaks.

Figma plans broader rollout across products in 2026, tying into ecosystems like no-code AI app builders for photo editing. This positions the platform as a full visual design hub amid AI trends. Industry views highlight liberation from Photoshop, with optimistic predictions for streamlined campaigns.
